thread.title: The Del restaurant is now open in Memorial area

author: chron.com
title: The Del restaurant is now open in Memorial area
text:
Photo: The Del Image 1 of / 11 11 Roasted fennel curry chicken served with potatoes, roasted winter vegetables and fennel curry at The Del, a new restaurant at 6565 Del Monte from the owners of Glass Wall, and Brooklyn Athletic Club
Photo: The Del Roasted fennel curry chicken served with potatoes, roasted winter... Image 2 of 11 Yellowfin tuna tartar with sweet chili sauce, crispy wontons, tomato and shiso at The Del, a new restaurant at 6565 Del Monte from the owners of Glass Wall, and Brooklyn Athletic Club
Photo: The Del Yellowfin tuna tartar with sweet chili sauce, crispy wontons,... Image 3 of 11 Interior design details at The Del, a new restaurant at 6565 Del Monte from the owners of Glass Wall, and Brooklyn Athletic Club. The restaurant sports a "country-club casual" atmosphere.

Photo: The Del Interior design details at The Del, a new restaurant at 6565 Del... Image 6 of 11 The year’s fourth quarter kicked off Oct. 1 with the opening of CorkScrew BBQ in its new brick-and-mortar location in Spring. The morning featured a long line of barbecue enthusiasts, who have gone without Will Buckman’s pork ribs for two months. Corkscrew was one of only four barbecue joints to make Alison Cook’s Top 100. It came in at No. 31.
Corkscrew BBQ: 26608 Keith, Spring; 832-592-1184
Photo: J.C. Reid The year’s fourth quarter kicked off Oct. 1 with the opening of. .. Image 7 of 11
The folks behind Glass Wall and the Brooklyn Athletic Club are behind this "fine casual" restaurant in a former Hartz Fried Chicken store. Serving classic American fare in a "country club casual" style, the restaurant is in its soft opening phase with limited hours so call ahead.
The Del: 6565 Del Monte, 713-750-9259
Photo: Courtesy Photo / The Del The folks behind Glass Wall and the Brooklyn Athletic Club are...
Image 8 of 11 It was December of 2014 when Houstonians were gifted with sweet news that Krispy Kreme would be returning to Houston. An optimistic story even gave an opening date of Feb. 17. Ten months later, there are two Krispy Kremes looking ready for their close-up but have yet to open. A tipster told the Chronicle that it looked like training was going on at the 8611 Westheimer store. The other store is located at 5611 Highway 6. The franchisee told the Houston Business Journal last month that he expected to the doughnut shops to open in mid-October.
It was December of 2014 when Houstonians were gifted with sweet... Image 9 of 11 Richard Knight, formerly of Feast, will open this upscale British pub Oct. 5 . It is one of three new restaurants from the Treadsack restaurant group opening this fall. Treadsack also is responsible for Down House, D&T Drive Inn and Johnny's Gold Brick.
Hunky Dory: 1801 N. Shepherd, 713-864-2450
Photo: Marie D. De Jesus, Houston Chronicle Richard Knight, formerly of Feast, will open this upscale British... Image 10 of 11 This is Houston native Ford Fry's first H-Town restaurant and he's tapped Bobby Matos, formerly of Ciao Bello, as his executive chef. Fry told the Chronicle that the River Oaks restaurant will be inspired by from iconic Bayou City restaurants from his childhood. State of Grace is expected to open late October.
State of Grace: 3258 Westheimer
Photo: Greg Morago This is Houston native Ford Fry's first H-Town restaurant and he's... Image 11 of 11 The Del restaurant is now open in Memorial area 1 / 11 Back to Gallery The Del , a new "fine casual" restaurant concept from the owners of Glass Wall and the Brooklyn Athletic Club , is now open at 6565 Del Monte off Voss.
Studewood Hospitality Group has quietly opened the restaurant, tucked behind Roegels Barbecue Co. and near the new Bramble restaurant from Randy Rucker. The restaurant has hired Albert Vasquez as its executive chef. Vasquez recently served as culinary director for Dish Society ; he also trained under Scott Tycer at Aires and Gravitas.
The menu offers starters and small plates that include gnocchi tots (potato gnocchi with a cheese and ale fondue topped with fried onions); barbecue shrimp; lamb chops with raw almond curry; and yellowfin tuna tartar served with crispy wontons and a sweet chili sauce. Starters range from $6 to $18. Soups, salads, burgers and sandwiches are offered (interesting options are the fattoush salad and a fried green tomatoes and bacon club sandwich).
Main dishes include braised short rib bolognese; ale-steam mussels and frites; seared snapper in a red pepper shrimp both and corn succotash; roasted fennel curry chicken; bratwurst with house-made sauerkraut and mashed potatoes; ribeye steak with a sweet chili glaze served with risotto; and steak frites. Entrees are priced between $15 and $35.
The Del's opening hours are Sunday through Thursday from 5 to 10 p.m. and Friday and Saturday from 5 to 11. The restaurant will add lunch in late October.
The Del opens without one of its guiding hands, restaurateur Shepard Ross, who, as CultureMap recently reported, has left Studewood Hospitality Group to focus on the highly praised Pax Americana restaurant.
